content.text:
# Draft:Jayram Powar

Jayram Powar (born unknown, possibly during a nap) is an Indian MERN stack developer, part-time dreamer, and full-time lecturer’s nightmare. He is best known for his ability to sleep during lectures while still managing to debug code better than fully awake individuals.[citation needed]
Early life and education
Powar spent much of his academic career asleep in classrooms. His teachers reported that his most common phrases included: "Sir, I was just resting my eyes," and "Can you repeat the question?"[citation needed]
He later transitioned to learning through online tutorials, usually at 2x speed, which he insists is "basically time travel."
Career
Powar works as a MERN stack developer, specializing in MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js.
Despite his unusual study habits, he has developed a reputation for writing clean code, though many suspect it is generated in his dreams.[citation needed]
Sleeping habits
Nicknamed Hibernate.js, Powar is known for what researchers have termed the Lecture-Induced Sleep Cycle (LISC). Professors initially mistook him for unconscious, but later discovered he was simply compiling knowledge in the background, like a hidden process.
Legacy
* First student to achieve 8 hours of sleep during a 3-hour class.[citation needed]
* Once answered a viva question correctly before waking up.[citation needed]
* Known for the quote: "Sleep is temporary, but MERN stack is permanent."
See also
* Power nap
* Dream journaling
* Sleep in animals
* Computer programming humor
References
External links
* [https://github.com/ Jayram Powar’s GitHub (possibly updated while asleep)]
